item.title: Exploring Pollen Data
item.author: grixor@gmail.com (Trang Le)
item.description: I wrote a [few functions](https://github.com/noamross/Pollen/commit/a7ebd4a9f46466da4c420b9437c73f8b185be56b#pollendatafuntions.R) to grab data and from the [Global Pollen Database](http://www.ncdc.noaa.gov/paleo/gpd.html): source("~/code/_Pollen/pollendatafuntions.R") ## Loading required package: stratigraph ## Loading required package: grid ## Loading required package: graphics ## Loading required package: stats billys

item.title: Pollen project sources
item.author: grixor@gmail.com (Trang Le)
item.description: Met with Stephen Pacala last week, who suggested we look into records of pollen sediments in lakes (varves) as potential data sources for early warning signals. Some potential sources: A paper reviewing regime shifts in the pollen records: Drying period in N. American midwest look promising Williams, J. W., J. L. Blois, and B. N. Shuman. 2011. Extrinsic and intrinsic forcing of abrupt ecological change: case studies from the late Quaternary.
